sperm can be an X or a Y 
chromosome.
If the egg is fertilised by 
a sperm containing an X 
chromosome, the baby will 
be a girl (XX). If the sperm 
contains a Y chromosome, the 
baby will be a boy (XY).
Twins, triplets or more
Identical twins occur when 
one fertilised egg splits into 
two; each baby will have the 
same	genes	–	and	therefore	
they will be the same sex and 
look very alike. Non-identical 
twins are more common. 
They are the result of two
